ygData.subject: Re: My 2 cents on the status of EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: Exactly. Earlier in the message about bugs he posted something about male barbs not showing shields... Pardon me but does that really effect game play? I think
ygData.messageBody:
Exactly. Earlier in the message about bugs he posted something about male
barbs not showing shields... Pardon me but does that really effect game
play? I think it looks cool when they have a bow and a sword, looking like
dual wielding newbies. Some people just need to look around the bugs and
just play, Verant fixed all really bad bugs. And with every patch you can
expect some bugs to come up, like the illusion bugs. I don't play my
enchanter anymore, so I never knew it wouldn't work. And when they patch
something they only test what is going in... Not every single little detail,
like enchanter's illusion spells effects. If they did that we would get a
new patch every 3 months and still be like we were in pre beta testing.

>From: "Mushin" <mushin@...>
>
>Swap Character between Servers? Are you crazy?
>
>This is an onlline world that is consistently changing what good would
>moving a character to anohter server do? So your friends are not on the
>same
>server as you.. create a new character on that server and play.
>
>
>
> >3) The inability to swap characters between different servers is stupid,
> >hopefully Microsoft learns from that major EQ mistake. (I'd still like to
> >play with all my friends and co-workers on the same server, instead of
> >spread out over 4 servers, pity EQ doesn't realize how critical this
>feature
> >is to allot of us - who the hell wants to start over? Hint: we'd pay to
>get
> >our chars moved over Verant.) The correct implementation would have been
> ><log-in:choose character:choose server:play> not what it is now. Major
>brain
> >fart here.
> >
>
>
